summary: The Improving Veterans’ Experience Act of 2025 aims to enhance the customer experience for veterans utilizing Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) benefits and services. It establishes the Veterans Experience Office within the VA, headed by a Chief Veterans Experience Officer, responsible for setting customer experience strategy, collecting veteran satisfaction data, providing guidance, and assessing VA information accuracy.  The bill mandates reports to Congress, addresses staff and resource allocation, ensures privacy protection, and includes a sunset clause.  It also requires a Comptroller General review of customer experience improvement efforts.
